result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kevin L Ptacek

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: DE has indiacted he does not intend to seek PCR

Defendant Kevin L Ptacek in court with attorney Bryce Alan Schoenborn.  James D Babbitt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Agreement reached.  Heard along with 15CM174, 16CM9 and 16CM10.  Court reads agreement.  DE understands his rights and waives his rights.  DE enters NC Plea to all charges.  Court finds DE guilty.  State feels that DE may have an AODA issue.  Withhold sentence, probation 2 yrs in 15CM174 and 2 yrs probation on Ct 1 in 16CM10 and 2 years probation in case 16CM9, concurrent.  Pay fine and court costs in each case and DNA sample and pay surcharge.  

15CM135 -  DRI

15CM174 - NC plea

16CM9 - Ct1, DRI.  Ct2 NC plea.  

16CM10 - Ct 1 NC Plea.  Ct 2 DRI.

Defendant Kevin L Ptacek in court with attorney Bryce Alan Schoenborn.  Defendant Kevin L Ptacek in custody.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Heard along with 15CM174, 16CM9, 16CM10.  Set for RH 4-28-16 @ 1:00PM  Review hearing scheduled for March 28, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

No possession/consumption or use of illegal or illicit drugs, or any substance intended to use to alter mental state or mood.  Defendant is not to possess or consume any medications not prescribed by a physician.  Not to possess or consume any illicit substances.  All prescribed medications must remain in the original container and be taken only as prescribed.  No contact with Wal Mart.  No drug paraphernalia.  All bonds concurrent.  Defendant is not to consume or possess alcohol.  Do not enter premises where alcohol is primary business, any bars taverns or liquor stores.

Defendant Kevin L Ptacek in court with attorney Bryce Alan Schoenborn.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Heard along with 16CM10, 16CM9, 15CM135, 15CM174.  16CM10,16CM9-INIT APP-  Waive reading of the CC, enter plea of NG to misdemeanor counts.  Bonds continue, all bonds concurrent.  Set for RH 2-16-16 @ 1:00PM.  DE will report to jail for booking.
Defendant's Invocation of Right to Counsel

Defendant Kevin L Ptacek in court with attorney Bryce Schoenborn.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Heard along with 15CM174-Init App.  Waive formal reading of the CC, enter a plea of NG to misdemeanor counts.  Bond will be concurrent to 15CM135, set for RH -19-16 @ 3:00PM.
Plea of not guilty and demand for twelve person jury trial

No possession or use of mind altering substances, or illicit substances.   Defendant is not to possess or consume any medications not prescribed by a physician.  All prescribed medications must remain in the original container and be taken only as prescribed.  No contact with WalMart.  No drug paraphernalia.

Defendant Kevin L Ptacek in court with attorney Annette M Barna.  Defendant Kevin L Ptacek in custody.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Quash warrant.  $1000.00 sign bond,   No possession or use of mind altering substances, or illicit substances.   Defendant is not to possess or consume any medications not prescribed by a physician.  No possession of drug paraphernalia.  Set for RH 11-17-15 @ 10:00AM.
Enter Wisconsin application only.  Will not extradite.
Defendant Kevin L Ptacek not in court.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State has a CONSV,   Court will authorize a $500.00 probable cause warrant, WI application only.
